title: Late Beck TD carries Miami into CFP title game
content: Carson Beck scrambled for a 3-yard touchdown with 18 seconds left, and Miami will head back home for a shot at its first national championship since 2001 after beating Mississippi 31-27 in an exhilarating CFP semifinal at the Fiesta Bowl.

title: QB Williams runs reverse, stays at Washington
content: QB Demond Williams Jr., who initially signed a big-money deal with Washington only to announce he was entering the transfer portal days later, has decided to remain with the Huskies.

title: Ravens' Monken: 'Didn't coach Lamar well enough'
content: OC Todd Monken accepted the blame for quarterback Lamar Jackson's regression in his third season in the system, telling the "Ryan Ripken Show" he "didn't coach Lamar well enough" and "didn't have as good of a relationship as I could have [with him]."

title: Wolves hold moment of silence for Renee Good
content: The Timberwolves held a moment of silence before their game Thursday night for the 37-year-old woman fatally shot in her car by an ICE officer.

title: Gold medalist Kim injured ahead of Winter Games
content: Two-time Olympic gold medalist Chloe Kim said Thursday that she dislocated a shoulder in training and her status for the Winter Games is uncertain.

title: Heat-Bulls PPD due to condensation on court
content: The scheduled game between the Chicago Bulls and Miami Heat was postponed because of condensation on the court in Chicago on Thursday night.

title: Skubal, Tigers face arbitration as deadline passes
content: Tarik Skubal and the Tigers failed to agree on a contract for this season before Thursday night's deadline to avoid arbitration, Detroit announced.

title: Ionescu to miss Unrivaled season due to injury
content: Sabrina Ionescu will not play in the second season of Unrivaled because of an injury sustained during the WNBA season.

title: üèÄ Six NBA trade offers to reshape playoff chase
content: Let's help Milwaukee build around Giannis, the Lakers and the Timberwolves fill major needs, and Golden State end its long saga.

title: Barnwell predicts the NFL playoff bracket: Could two lower seeds go to the Super Bowl?
content: Four road teams winning in the wild-card round -- and two of them making it all the way to the Super Bowl? Let's project the full playoffs.

title: Connelly breaks down Miami-Ole Miss, Oregon-Indiana
content: Our deep dive into the semifinals dissects the matchups that will determine who moves on to the title game.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Where every team stands in the new year
content: Though there are still free agents to be signed, let's reassess the standings now that we're midway through the offseason.

title: The bizarre world of arbitration -- and the ace whose record raise could rock the system
content: Baseball's unique offseason contract process is built on comps. Enter the pitcher who is beyond comparison.

title: Grading the Trae Young trade: How did the Hawks and Wizards fare?
content: Trae Young is headed from the Hawks to the Wizards for CJ McCollum and Corey Kispert. Which team fared best? We graded the trade.

title: Browns locked in for 'next 120 days': Coach, draft and a QB
content: Are Cleveland's owners letting a 5-12 season weigh them down? Not a chance. They're pressing forward.

title: 'Even if it's not safe, I still want to play': What NHL players, owners, execs are saying about Olympic ice
content: While the rink won't be perfect, there's also an overwhelming sentiment shared by all stakeholders: The men's Olympic hockey tournament will go on.

title: Arsenal still in control of title race; Liverpool show they need to improve
content: Both Arsenal and Liverpool settled for a point in a scoreless draw, but it was a missed opportunity for the Gunners to extend their lead in the Premier League.

title: Live trade tracker: Details for every deal of the 2025-26 season
content: Here's every trade of this regular season, starting with the Hawks dealing away franchise star Trae Young.

title: Power Rankings: Unbeaten Vanderbilt, Nebraska crack top 10
content: The Commodores and Cornhuskers have outperformed preseason expectations, headlining this week's biggest risers.

title: Power Rankings: Who is really the top team in the Big 12?
content: Texas Tech, one of four unbeaten teams left in women's D-I, and Baylor enter the top 16 as UNC and Notre Dame exit.

title: Secret sauce to Bills beating the Jaguars? A big key is the O-line
content: What makes up the Bills O-line unit's success and its diverse personalities off the field? Let them explain.

title: Mendoza vs. Moore: Why the CFP semifinals will have a big impact on the NFL draft
content: New York Jets GM Darren Mougey will be heavily evaluating quarterbacks in the college playoffs ahead of the draft.

title: Buzz: Hoosiers-Ducks winner likely to be favorite in national championship game
content: The winner of Friday's semifinal between Indiana and Oregon is expected to be the favorite in the national title game, regardless of opponent.

title: How Trevor Lawrence's grill gift was kept a surprise -- and came together
content: The quarterback's grill came from a collaboration of his mom, wife, former Clemson teammate and the Jaguars social media team.

title: Newest layer in the Packers-Bears rivalry? Cheese grater hats
content: DJ Moore's celebration helped turn a foam cheese grater hat into the latest Bears-Packers rivalry fixture.

title: Men's hockey check-in: Which teams are poised for a Frozen Four run?
content: A look at the top storylines, players to watch and Frozen Four picks as we hit the season's second half.

title: Pound-for-pound rankings: Fundora moves up; a new name in the top 10
content: Gabriela Fundora keeps moving up and Elif Nur Turhan scored another impressive TKO victory. Here's the latest women's pound-for-pound rankings.

title: Knueppel, Adebayo headline biggest surprises and disappointments
content: Our panel of fantasy basketball experts lists their biggest surprises and disappointments so far this season.

title: Flex and superflex rankings for 2026
content: An early look at the top 200 QBs, RBs, WRs and TEs for 2026 drafts, updated throughout the fantasy football offseason.

title: Ranking the top American tennis players as 2026 begins
content: Coco Gauff won another major title in 2025, and Taylor Fritz continued to lead the American men. But who else is set to make a move in 2026?

title: Ja'Marr Chase offered an ARC Raiders player Bengals season tickets for a revive
content: The Cincinnati Bengals wide receiver tried to bargain for his virtual life in ARC Raiders -- to no avail.

title: ‚ÄòPM Modi did not call Trump‚Äô: US commerce secretary on trade deadlock ‚Äî explains impasse
content: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick stated PM Modi's failure to call President Trump prevented a trade deal. This comes as the US imposes tariffs on countries buying Russian oil. India faces tariffs on its goods. Both nations are negotiating a comprehensive trade agreement with a goal to significantly boost bilateral trade by 2030.

title: 'Jana Nayagan' gets clearance: Madras HC clears Vijay's movie; orders U/A certificate
content: Madras High Court has directed the CBFC to grant a 'UA 16+' censor certificate for the theatrical release of actor Vijay's Tamil movie 'Jana Nayagan'. The court set aside the chairperson's decision to refer the film to a revising committee, emphasizing that the producer invested Rs 500 crore and had already made 27 modifications as per board recommendations.

title: Mahua, Derek dragged away from outside Amit Shah's office; TMC protests over I-PAC raid
content: TMC leaders, including MPs, were detained protesting ED raids on I-PAC offices in Kolkata. The party alleges the raids, targeting election strategy data, are politically motivated harassment by the Union government ahead of West Bengal polls. Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee condemned the action, calling it a vendetta and accusing the BJP of attempting to steal party documents.

title: 'Shoot first, ask questions later': Denmark's warning to Trump; tensions soar over Greenland
content: Denmark has warned its troops are under standing orders to "shoot first and ask questions later" if Greenland is attacked, as Europe grows anxious over potential US military action. The US is reportedly considering cash payments to Greenlanders to encourage independence from Denmark, a move European leaders are rallying against.

title: Bengaluru road rage: Zepto delivery executive beaten, hit on chest with helmet
content: A Zepto delivery executive was assaulted by two scooty riders after a minor collision in Mahadevpura. The attackers reportedly used a helmet and punches, leaving the executive vulnerable. An elderly bystander intervened, confronting the assailants and helping to end the attack. Police are investigating the incident.

title: Gmail‚Äôs AI moment: Google CEO Pichai on April 1 launch; 20 years later, Gmail enters Gemini era
content: Google is integrating Gemini 3 AI models into Gmail, transforming it into a proactive inbox assistant. New features include AI Overviews to summarize long conversations, automated drafting and proofreading tools, and an AI-powered inbox that prioritizes critical tasks. These updates aim to enhance user efficiency and manage email volume effectively.

title: 'Daal roti nahi chalti ...': Virat Kohli's brother slams critics
content: India batter Virat Kohli's brother, Vikas, has defended the cricketer against critics, suggesting some use Virat's name for relevance. This comes after former player Sanjay Manjrekar's comments on Kohli's Test career. Meanwhile, Kohli is preparing for the upcoming ODI series against New Zealand, aiming to continue his exceptional recent form.

title: Goa MP, a Kargil veteran, gets SIR notice; CEO slams BLO for goof-up
content: South Goa MP Capt Viriato Fernandes received an Election Commission notice to prove his identity, prompting the state CEO to blame a BLO for dereliction of duty. The system auto-generated the notice due to unmapped voter details, but the MP's name will be retained after clarification.

title: Delhi-NCR sees season's lowest at 4.6¬∞C after unexpected early morning rain
content: Delhi-NCR experienced an unexpected early Friday rain spell, intensifying the cold wave and failing to significantly improve alarmingly high air pollution levels. The showers, accompanied by cold winds, lowered the chill factor, with minimum temperatures expected around 6¬∞C. Dense fog is also anticipated, with cold-day conditions likely to persist across northern and central regions.

title: Musk says he's impressed with China; highlights its rapid EV & solar growth
content: Elon Musk noted China's rapid adoption of electric vehicles, batteries, and solar power, mirroring his suggestions. He emphasized batteries as key to boosting US energy output without new power plants. Tesla's Megapacks and Megablock offer utility-scale storage solutions. Musk also warned of potential silver price hikes due to Chinese export restrictions.

title: 'Cannot support all his beliefs': Tharoor calls himself 'uncritical fan' of Nehru
content: Shashi Tharoor, while respecting Jawaharlal Nehru as India's democratic founder, acknowledged his mistakes, stating the Modi government unfairly scapegoats him.  He noted the 1962 China war defeat as a potential Nehru misstep, but criticized blaming him for all current issues. Tharoor also shared personal anecdotes about his writing journey and Kerala's reading culture.

title: Philanthropy push: Jeff Bezos‚Äô ex-wife donates billions to non-profits; biggest giveaway in 2025
content: Mackenzie Scott, ex-wife of Amazon's founder, has significantly reduced her stake in the e-commerce giant, selling shares worth $13 billion.  She continues her massive philanthropic efforts, donating $7.1 billion to non-profits in 2025 alone, including over $1.2 billion to Historically Black Colleges and Universities.  These substantial, unrestricted grants are seen as a counterpoint to tech companies scaling back DEI initiatives.

title: T20 WC standoff: Bangladesh sends second letter to ICC, reiterates venue shift from India
content: Bangladesh Cricket Board has formally requested the ICC to shift their T20 World Cup matches from India to Sri Lanka due to security concerns. The team has refused to travel to India, escalating uncertainty just weeks before the tournament. The BCB's stance has hardened following the IPL release of Mustafizur Rahman.

title: Writing on the wall? Delhi University bids adieu to ‚Äòwalls of democracy‚Äô
content: Delhi University has reportedly denotified its designated 'Walls of Democracy' where students could post notices and express opinions. This move came after security staff prevented students from pasting posters, tearing them down and informing them of the university's decision.

title: 'Don't need international law': Trump says 'my own morality' only restraint on global power
content: US President Donald Trump asserted his "own morality" as the sole limit on his power to order military action globally, even as he spoke of peace.  His administration has pursued an aggressive military posture, launching operations in Venezuela and threatening other nations, while Trump also expressed a desire for US "ownership" of Greenland.

title: PSL expansion - Two franchises sold for less than IPL superstars' paycheques
content: The Pakistan Super League is expanding to eight teams for the 2026 season, with two new franchises sold for a combined $12.75 million. This figure highlights a significant financial disparity compared to the Indian Premier League, where even individual player salaries and franchise valuations far exceed these new PSL team prices, underscoring the IPL's immense economic power.

title: ‚ÄòShe behaved horribly, ran over him‚Äô: Trump defends ICE agent who shot Minneapolis woman dead
content: US President Trump defended an ICE agent after a fatal shooting in Minneapolis, claiming the woman tried to run over the officer. The woman, Renee Nicole Good, was killed by multiple shots fired into her car during a federal operation. Local leaders disputed the federal account, with the mayor calling for ICE to leave the city.

title: Mystery murder: 30-year-old‚Äôs body chopped into 6 pieces; head stuffed in drum
content: A 30-year-old man was found brutally murdered and dismembered in Ludhiana, his head discovered in a drum. Police have registered a case against his friend and the friend's wife, who were captured on CCTV carrying the drum. The motive is currently under investigation.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 25,900; BSE Sensex up over 140 points
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmarks, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, rose in trade on Friday after days of fall. While Nifty50 was above 25,900, BSE Sensex was up almost 150 points.

title: What happens if Trump's tariffs are struck down? Traders 'worried' for $150 bn refunds
content: US companies and trade lawyers are bracing for a potential $150 billion refund battle as the Supreme Court hears a case challenging President Trump's use of emergency powers for global tariffs. The outcome hinges on whether the International Emergency Economic Powers Act grants authority for such duties, with skepticism from justices fueling expectations of tariffs being struck down.

title: Prada bottles the warmth and comfort of chai with Infusion de Santal Chai perfume
content: Italian luxury brand Prada has launched a new unisex fragrance, Infusion de Santal Chai, inspired by the popular Indian beverage. This scent blends creamy sandalwood with spicy chai latte notes, enhanced by citrus and cardamom for a warm yet fresh aroma. The unique perfume aims to capture the comforting essence of chai, sparking curiosity and debate among consumers.

title: Love, sex aur dhokha: Bengaluru techie strips for ‚ÄòAI girlfriend‚Äô; falls into sextortion racket
content: A 22-year-old software professional fell victim to a sextortion scam after connecting with a deepfake girlfriend on a dating app. Coerced into a video call and secretly recorded, he was then blackmailed for Rs 1.5 lakh. Police are investigating the AI-generated scam and urge users to exercise caution.

title: Fortnite v39.20 update: Release times for all regions
content: Fortnite's v39.20 update arrives January 9, 2025, featuring a massive South Park crossover. Players can expect iconic characters like Stan, Kyle, Cartman, and Kenny as mech-suited skins, alongside the controversial Towelie as a sidekick. A 'Stick of Truth' mythic item and a new five-player squad mode are also rumored. A special mini-pass will offer exclusive collaboration rewards.

title: Anti-Khamenei protests rage on: Iran govt shuts internet; Trump warns to 'hit very hard'
content: Iran has imposed severe communication restrictions, including internet and phone shutdowns, amidst escalating protests against economic hardship. Exiled crown prince Reza Pahlavi condemned the government's actions, urging international intervention. Meanwhile, US President Trump issued a stern warning against violent crackdowns, while US officials voiced support for peaceful demonstrators. The unrest, fueled by currency collapse and inflation, has spread nationwide.

title: ‚ÄòCan I crack your back‚Äô: Teen narrates sexual assault by national shooting coach
content: A national shooting coach, Ankush Bharadwaj, faces charges under the POCSO Act for allegedly sexually assaulting a 17-year-old trainee at a five-star hotel. The incident occurred after a match, with the coach reportedly forcing himself on the shooter. Bharadwaj has been suspended by the National Rifles Association of India following the FIR.

title: Meerut horror: Mother killed while shielding daughter from abductors
content: A 50-year-old woman in Meerut died after being struck with a weapon while trying to protect her daughter from abductors. The attackers forcibly attempted to take the daughter, and when the mother intervened, she was fatally injured. Police have registered a murder and abduction case and formed teams to apprehend the suspects.

title: 'Amit Shah is nasty, naughty‚Äô: Mamata Banerjee says ED snatched our poll strategy
content: The ED searched I-PAC's office and a director's home in a five-year-old case, prompting CM Mamata Banerjee to label it political vendetta. Banerjee visited the director's residence, leaving with documents, and later went to I-PAC's office, accusing the Union Home Minister of attempting to seize party strategies.

title: Candace Owens questions Charlie Kirk after sharing unseen image with no blood
content: Candace Owens shared claims about a photo she says shows Charlie Kirk after an alleged shooting. She questioned the official story and named people she said could not be trusted. However, there is no verified evidence, police record, or official confirmation that Charlie Kirk was shot or killed. Her statements remain unproven and widely disputed.

title: 'Dhurandhar' sets week 5 record with Rs 51.25 crore haul
content: Aditya Dhar's 'Dhurandhar' starring Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna has achieved a remarkable feat, setting a new box office record for week 5 collections. The film's fifth week raked in Rs 51.25 crore, surpassing the previous record by a significant margin. 'Dhurandhar' has now amassed a net total of Rs 790.

title: Tommy Fleetwood & Clare Fleetwood net worth: Golf earnings, sponsors, family
content: Tommy and Clare Fleetwood have built a significant fortune through Tommy's successful golf career, prize money, and lucrative brand deals. Clare, as his manager, plays a crucial role in their financial success and their private family life. Their collaborative approach has led to both on-course achievements and long-term financial stability.

title: NASA cancels planned ISS spacewalk after astronaut falls ill
content: A medical issue with an unnamed astronaut has forced NASA to postpone spacewalks at the International Space Station, raising concerns about the Crew 11 mission's duration.  While the astronaut is stable, the incident highlights the inherent challenges and need for flexibility in long-term space operations. NASA prioritizes crew safety and will provide updates soon.

title: Stefon Diggs‚ÄìCardi B drama grows as Patriots playoff distraction
content: The New England Patriots are winning, but celebrity drama, particularly involving Stefon Diggs and Cardi B, overshadows their on-field success. While quarterback Drake Maye shows promise, Diggs' crucial role in the offense is undeniable. Coach Mike Vrabel attempts to maintain focus amidst the off-field noise, but the team's playoff hopes hinge on managing these distractions.

title: 2020 Delhi riots case: Sharjeel Imam denies 'mentor link' with Umar Khalid
content: Sharjeel Imam's counsel argued in Karkardooma Court that no conspiracy could be proven against him in the 2020 Delhi riots case. The defense highlighted the absence of any communication linking Imam to co-accused Umar Khalid and stated his speeches lacked a causal link to the violence.

title: Buying $200 bn worth of bonds! Trump‚Äôs new push to bring ‚Äòmortgage rates down‚Äô
content: US President Donald Trump plans a $200 billion federal purchase of mortgage bonds to lower rates and ease housing affordability concerns. Funds from Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac will be used, aiming to reduce monthly payments. This move comes ahead of midterm elections, though experts question its effectiveness against deeper market issues.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research recommends buying  Hindustan Unilever, and Tata Power as top stock picks for January 9, 2026. Here‚Äôs its view on Nifty and Bank Nifty:

title: Drake Maye‚Äôs wife rises from TikTok baker to NBC Sports spotlight
content: Ann Michael Maye's kitchen creations are now on NBC Sports Boston. Her show 'Beyond Bakemas' builds on her popular holiday baking series. Maye gained fame with 'Bakemas' in late 2025, baking a new dessert daily. She then launched a healthy recipes series for 2026. Her presence continues as the NFL postseason approaches.

title: Land-for-jobs case: Delhi court frames charges against Lalu Prasad
content: The CBI filed charge sheets against Lalu Prasad, his wife and former Bihar Chief Minister Rabri Devi, their son Tejashwi Yadav and others in connection with the alleged scam

title: 6-day Sri Mailaralingeshwar annual festival in Mailapur in Yadgir district of Karnataka to begin on January 12
content: Deputy Commissioner Harshal Bhoyar directed officials to organise the annual fair peacefully and ensure that all basic facilities, including drinking water and makeshift toilets, are put in place for devotees

title: Lighter school bags, classrooms without ‚Äòbackbenchers‚Äô: Kerala‚Äôs new lesson plan
content: A draft report proposing a reduction in weight of school bags and creating classrooms without 'backbenchers' has been approved by State Curriculum Steering Committee, General Education Minister V. Sivankutty has said

title: CUK‚Äôs language lab emerges as key platform for strengthening English skills among rural students in Karnataka
content: Centre for English Language Teaching (CELT) follows a learner-centric and need-based approach, first identifying gaps in students‚Äô language skills and then preparing customised content with emphasis on grammar, vocabulary and core communication skills

title: Mamata protest in Kolkata LIVE: West Bengal CM to take to streets against ED raids on I-PAC office
content: ED officials raided the house of Pratik Jain, chief of political consultancy firm Indian Political Action Committee (I-PAC) on Thursday

title: The Hindu Group signs MoU with RV Institute of Technology and Management in Bengaluru
content: Citing the ‚ÄòGo Change the World‚Äô motive, college Principal Nagashettappa Biradar emphasised carrying this vision forward by empowering students to enhance their communication and writing abilities

title: Malayalam Language Bill, 2025: What it proposes and why it has triggered opposition outside Kerala | Explained
content: In October, Kerala Assembly passed Malayalam Language Bill, establishing Malayalam as State‚Äôs sole official language for government, education, and commerce. The Bill, which awaits Governor‚Äôs assent, has faced opposition, especially from Karnataka govt, citing concerns for Kannada-speaking residents in Kasaragod. But Kerala Law Minister has argued that the Bill includes protections for linguistic minorities

title: Studio Green rushes to Madras High Court to get Karthi-starrer Vaa Vaathiyar released
content: The production house urges the court to modify its December 2025 order prohibiting the release of the movie without paying ‚Çπ21.78 crore

title: Now, vehicle owners needn‚Äôt take vehicles to RTA offices for registration
content: As per the new stipulation, vehicle buyers will no longer be required to take their new vehicles to RTOs for inspection as part of the registration process

title: Indian top IT firms set for another tepid quarter on weak US demand, client spending
content: Brokerages expect the top six IT firms by revenue to post about 4% year-on-year revenue growth and a 5% rise in profit for the December quarter on average

title: High Court verdict in plea over Telangana DGP appointment today
content: On October 10, city-based social activist T. Dhangopal Rao filed a writ petition challenging the appointment of IPS officer B. Shivadhar Reddy as the State Director General of Police

title: Supreme Court sets aside A.P. HC order quashing FIRs filed by ACB
content: The apex court directs the accused public servants to cooperate for the speedy conclusion of the probe

title: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah urges Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan to withdraw Malayalam Bhasha Bill 2025
content: The Karnataka Border Area Development Authority petitioned Kerala Government on Wednesday urging him to reject the bill; Karnataka government fears the bill have negative impact on Kannada speaking linguistic minority in Kerala

title: Pakistan to take up with India any development activity in violation of IWT: Foreign Office
content: Foreign Office spokesperson Tahir Andrabi also said that the IWT remains a binding international instrument and there is no provision for abeyance of the treaty

title: Telangana land owner on ground, not in official records
content: Decades-old Sada Bainamas ‚Äî informal, plain-paper land agreements ‚Äî have left over nine lakh farmers in Telangana without titles as procedural hurdles and record discrepancies stall regularisation under the Bhu Bharati Act, 2025. Small and marginal farmers are calling for Gram Sabha verifications and clearer rules to secure ownership and reduce disputes, report¬†M. Rajeev, P. Sridhar and P. Laxma Reddy

title: Chittoor poised for a white revolution
content: On the road to recovery from a severe setback it suffered years ago following the closure of the Cooperative Milk Producers‚Äô Union, Chittoor district's dairy sector is set for a big leap riding on the relentless efforts of small and marginal farmers who constitute the buik of its operations, and the multi-pronged strategy rolled out by the government may turn out to be the much-needed push to shift the gear, writes  K. Umashanker

title: Defence corridor will be set up in Jaggayyapeta: Vijayawada MP
content: State government has sanctioned ‚Çπ100 crore to provide a permanent solution to the woes related to drinking water supply in Jaggayyapeta town, says Sivanath

title: Despite ban, roosterfight arenas being set up for Sankranti festival
content: Cases will be booked under AP Gaming Act and Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act against those who organise roosterfights, says NTR District Collector

title: PM Modi chairs roundtable with AI startups ahead of February summit
content: The firms had qualified for the AI Impact Summit‚Äôs which sought submissions from AI firms that could lead real-world impact

title: Union Minister expresses concern over alarming pollution in Odisha‚Äôs Angul-Talcher region
content: In separate letters, Mr. Pradhan emphasised on adoption of a mechanised coal transportation system along with advanced dust suppression measures

title: Jharkhand BJP chief accuses Soren‚Äôs government of robbing the rights of tribals
content: Babulal Marandi demanded that the Jharkhand government should reconsider the declared rules, otherwise, the BJP will take the matter to the people‚Äôs court in every village

title: Women in Rajasthan‚Äôs Jalore, almost disconnected
content: A caste panchayat in Rajasthan‚Äôs Jalore district banned women‚Äôs access to smartphones, revoking the ban when faced with outrage. While the village heads said it was the women who demanded it because the children overused them, some women say it‚Äôs about control, finds Alisha Dutta

title: 13 youths from conflict-scarred Manipur get jobs in Japan
content: Governor Ajay Kumar Bhalla interacted with them before their departure to work in nursing, hospitality, manufacturing, and other sectors

title: ED, I-PAC move Calcutta HC over searches on firm's office, Pratik Jain‚Äôs residence
content: Justice Suvra Ghosh, before whom the matters were mentioned, is likely to take them up for hearing on Friday (January 9)

title: ACB unearths ‚Äòscam‚Äô worth ‚Çπ2,000 crore in Rajasthan‚Äôs midday meal scheme
content: The ACB‚Äôs probe found that the officials associated with the scheme and CONFED allegedly changed rules in collusion to exclude eligible firms from the tender process and extended undue benefits to favoured companies

title: Umar Khalid is not my mentor, Sharjeel Imam tells Delhi court
content: He had never spoken to Mr. Khalid in the five years he spent at Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU), Mr. Imam‚Äôs counsel said on his behalf

title: Mizoram Cabinet is against extending Governor‚Äôs Rule in troubled tribal council
content: The council of ministers said there was no justification for extending Governor‚Äôs Rule for another six months

title: Tej Pratap‚Äôs invitation to NDA leaders for Dahi-Chura feast creates political ripples in Bihar
content: The occasion in Bihar is also seen as a political¬†event of clearing the differences and a table of negotiation in which political rivalry is settled down

title: Work on first government critical care block for tribals in Vellore nearing completion
content: The new facility, which costs ‚Çπ23.75 crore, also has a spacious out-patient ward with seating arrangements for 100 people

title: The long arm of law catches up with former Kerala Minister in evidence-tampering case
content: It took three decades for a case booked for criminal conspiracy and causing disappearance of evidence against a legislator in Kerala to be decided by a trial court. Sarath Babu George tracks the legal and investigative processes that culminated in the conviction and subsequent disqualification of Antony Raju

title: Unauthorised banners on NSC Bose Road pose challenges to motorists
content: One of the banners fell due to strong winds recently; these structures further reduce the already encroached road space; Corporation officials say the banners will be removed if found to be illegal

title: Amit Shah reviews security situation in J&K
content: Union Home Minister directs security agencies to ensure the goal of ‚Äòterror-free Jammu and Kashmir‚Äô is achieved at the earliest

title: The making of a Jallikattu bull
content: In Thottiapatti near Madurai, a hub for buying and rearing jallikattu bulls, economy is built around native breeds

title: BJP suspends three members in Thiruvananthapuram
content: The three were suspended for allegedly working to defeat the party‚Äôs candidates in three wards of the Corporation in the recently held local body elections

title: Three Indians among crew on board Russian oil tanker seized by U.S.: report
content: U.S. government had been repeatedly provided with reliable information, including from the Russian Foreign Ministry, about the ship‚Äôs Russian origin and its civilian status, Moscow asserted

title: Average asset of 102 re-elected MPs rises by 110% between 2014-2024: ADR
content: The top ten MPs who registered the highest increase in their assets, includes BJP's Udayanraje Bhonsle, Poonamben Maadam, Hema Malini, Nishikant Dubey; YSRCP's PV Midhun Reddy; Shiromani Akali Dal's Harsimrat Kaur Badal; Trinamool Congress' Shatrughan Sinha; and NCP (SP)'s Supriya Sule

title: Gadgil was a man of compassion, remembers V.S. Vijayan
content: Ecologist Vijayan, a long-time associate of Gadgil, says the latter rooted his approach in science and ecology, and always chose to air his views frankly and fearlessly.

title: Kerala CM accuses Congress of seeking to lionise Donald Trump by racing to name a road in his honour in Andhra Pradesh
content: Pinarayi Vijayan says Congress and BJP were equally subservient to the U.S.‚Äôs expansionist capitalism. He urges Centre to dispatch a bipartisan political delegation to Venezuela to express solidarity

title: Ecologist‚Äôs advocacy shaped political and ecological narratives in Kerala
content: Eminent ecologist‚Äôs contributions shaped socio-political and ecological narratives of the State over one and a half decades in an unprecedented manner

title: Congress voices concern over ‚Äòturbulent times‚Äô in Indo-U.S. relations
content: Jairam Ramesh points to recent legislative and political signals from Washington that have caused discomfort in New Delhi; he also cites Trump‚Äôs praise for Pakistan Army chief Asim Munir

title: Enquiry into private universities is neither a witch-hunt nor playing ‚Äòheadmaster‚Äô: SC
content: A Bench headed by Justice Ahsanuddin Amanullah pulled up the Centre for not filing an affidavit affirmed by the Union Cabinet Secretary despite a categorical order from the top court in November 2025

title: Dravidian model views technology as a tool for social uplift, says Chief Minister M.K. Stalin
content: Speaking at the fourth edition of UmagineTN, he says the State is shifting from its traditional information technology services to high-tech development, start-ups, and innovation-driven economy

title: A.P. should emerge as national role model in mangrove conservation, says Pawan
content: The Deputy CM stresses that protecting existing mangroves while expanding new plantations is essential to minimise losses caused by frequent natural disasters, particularly in the Krishna and Godavari basins

title: Karnataka State Film Awards 2020 and 2021: M.S. Sathyu honoured with Puttanna Kanagal Award
content: Legendary filmmaker M.S. Sathyu clinched Puttanna Kanagal Award for 2020, while popular actor Jayamala took home Dr. Rajkumar Award

title: J&K CM to find room for 50 MBBS students left high and dry by Vaishno Devi college
content: The CM stressed that the students cleared NEET on merit and it is our legal responsibility to adjust them

title: BJP MP, State government at odds in Chhattisgarh over Scouts and Guides jamboree
content: Raipur MP Brijmohan Agrawal challenges removal as State Bharat Scouts and Guides president ahead of national event

title: Congress seeks clarification from Centre, M.P. govt. on Indore deaths; alleges criminal negligence
content: Congress spokesperson Pawan Khera says the tragedy exposed the ‚Äòugly, brutal and utterly callous face of the BJP govt.‚Äô; adds that mandatory quarterly water quality tests were not conducted, monitoring reports were not prepared or submitted, and key infrastructure projects remained incomplete or poorly managed in Madhya Pradesh

title: Govt. seeks feedback on draft Bill to regulate pesticides, promote ‚Äòsafe and effective‚Äô use
content: The Bill strives to minimise risk to human beings, animals, living organisms other than pests, and the environment, and promote pesticides that are ‚Äúbiological and based on traditional knowledge‚Äù

title: 4 PJTAU staff suspended for question paper leakage
content: 35 on-service students of 3rd year surrendered to Agri. Dept. for their involvement in the irregularity

title: India and Iran to start diplomatic calendar for 75th anniversary of bilateral ties
content: The celebration of bilateral ties will begin with the visit of Iran Foreign Minister Syed Abbas Araghchi that is expected later this month

title: Watch: Demolition drive around Faiz-e-Ilahi Mosque in Delhi triggers clashes | Ground Report
content: A late-night demolition to remove encroachments around the Faiz-e-Ilahi Mosque at Turkman Gate, carried out on Delhi High Court directions, led to stone-pelting, injuries to police personnel and multiple arrests.

title: Increased money in politics and drugs on the streets needs to be analysed: Raj Thackeray
content: In an interview with a regional channel, Thackeray cousins Uddhav and Raj said that the people were being neglected, and power was being misused. They highlighted their agenda over how the Marathi Manoos have been exploited and betrayed, and how migration has taken away the rights of locals

title: Amid Kogilu row, BDA takes up demolition near Thanisandra without notices; Commissioner orders probe
content: While BDA maintains that 13 houses are demolished, residents say that more than 20 houses are affected; Many of the displaced families were tenants who had been living in the area for nearly five years

title: PM Modi to visit Somnath Temple on January 11, hold yatra
content: Prime Minister¬†Narendra Modi recalled his earlier visits to Somnath Temple and spoke about the resilience of faith despite repeated attacks on the shrine by invaders

title: CM Mamata to protest in Kolkata against ED raids on I-PAC office
content: The Trinamool chief says the raids are ‚Äúpolitically motivated to steal party data‚Äù, including candidate list for the upcoming elections

title: Yoga halves opioid withdrawal time, finds NIMHANS study
content: Participants, who received yoga alongside buprenorphine-based treatment, achieved withdrawal resolution in a median of five days, compared with nine days among those on medication alone, the study found

title: BJP stages protest for second day over police ‚Äòdisrobing‚Äô woman during arrest
content: After their protest till late evening in Hubballi on Wednesday, the BJP workers staged another protest on Thursday, this time in Dharwad

title: DGP, CoP must explain inaction against those who used filthy language in the presence of retired judge: HC
content: Justices G. Jayachandran and K. Kumaresh Babu call for an explanation after former judge V. Parthiban writes to the court narrating the incident

title: Denmark explores collaboration with Kudumbashree in the field of elderly care
content: The discussions centered on training Kudumbashree workers to serve as social healthcare helpers in Denmark, building on the success of the K for Care project, which has already trained over a thousand caregivers in Kerala.¬†The move requires more extensive training and Danish language studies.

title: Cabinet gives nod for setting up AP Logistics Infrastructure Corporation, AP Logistics Fund
content: Among others, it clears the proposal to bear the burden of true-up electricity charges by repaying¬†to the DISCOMs in six monthly instalments

title: "Not Afraid, I Have Been Dead For 47 Years": Iran Woman's "Bloody" Protest
content: As Iran intensified efforts to crack down on anti-government protests, a video of an elderly woman protestor defying the Islamic regime went viral, becoming a symbol of nationwide agitation driven by economic hardship and growing public anger.

title: Amid Hindi Imposition Row, Karnataka vs Kerala Over Mandatory Malayalam
content: Kerala government's move to make Malayalam the compulsory first language in schools located in border areas with Karnataka has drawn strong objections from the neighbouring state.

title: All About Jonathan Ross, Iraq War Veteran Who Shot 37-Year-Old Mother In US
content: The federal agent who shot and killed a driver in Minneapolis is an Iraq War veteran who has served for nearly two decades in the Border Patrol and US Immigration and Customs Enforcement, according to records

title: US Willing To Sell Venezuelan Oil To India? What White House Official Said
content: The Donald Trump administration in the United States is reportedly willing to sell Venezuelan oil to India under a new US-controlled framework, amid Washington's pressure on New Delhi to stop its Russian crude trade.

title: Pak Woman In UP Hides Nationality For Job, Luck Runs Out 30 Years Later
content: Police here have registered an FIR against a woman for securing a job in the basic education department by allegedly concealing her Pakistani nationality, officials said on Thursday.

title: Madras High Court To Hear Contempt Case Over Deepam Orders Today
content: The Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court will on Friday take up contempt proceedings before Justice GR Swaminathan against senior district and police officials over the alleged non-compliance of its orders on lighting the Karthigai Deepam

title: Bengal Governor Receives Death Threat, Security Tightened At Lok Bhavan
content: Security was tightened at Kolkata Lok Bhavan on late Thursday night after West Bengal Governor CV Ananda Bose received a threatening email stating "will blast him", allegedly warning of a blast and posing a threat to his life.

title: Bengal Governor Gets Threat Email Day After High Drama Linked To Coal Smuggling Scam
content: West Bengal Governor CV Ananda Bose has received an email threatening to "blast" him, after which the authorities tightened security at his official home and office, Lok Bhawan.

title: Anti-Khamenei Protests Intensify In Iran, Exiled Prince  Reza Pahlavi Gives Rallying Cry
content: The protests against Iran's Islamic regime, led by Supreme Leader Seyyed Ali Hosseini Khamenei, have intensified in Tehran.

title: Why S Jaishankar Had To Travel 670 Km By Road In US To Meet UN Chief
content: US security officials drove External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar 416 miles during a September government shutdown after commercial flights were grounded, according to a State Department report released this week.

title: US Immigration Agent Shot A Woman. Do Rules Allow Officers To Open Fire?
content: A federal immigration operation in Minneapolis turned deadly this week when a US Immigration and Customs Enforcement officer shot and killed 37-year-old Renee Good during a confrontation involving her vehicle.

title: 'Not Nehru's Uncritical Fan': Shashi Tharoor's Nuanced Take, And Jab At BJP
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Thursday said that while he regards India's first Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru as the founder of Indian democracy, his admiration is not without criticism, asserting that acknowledging Nehru's mistakes is necessary.

title: Trump Looks Forward To "Saying Hello" To Venezuela's Machado Next Week
content: US President Donald Trump indicated on Thursday that Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado was coming to Washington next week.

title: 'Will Shoot First, Ask Questions Later': Denmark's Greenland Warning To US
content: The Danish defence ministry said that soldiers will be required to shoot first and ask questions later if the United States invades Greenland.

title: During Stray Dogs Hearing, Supreme Court's 'Cats And Rats' Quip
content: The Supreme Court said that it has not directed for every dog to be removed from the streets, adding that they should be treated according to rules.

title: Cab Driver Flees With Passenger's Valuables Worth Over Rs 20 Lakh, Arrested
content: The Commissionerate Police on Thursday arrested an Ola cab driver on charges of fleeing with valuables worth over Rs 20 lakh belonging to a passenger in Bhubaneswar. The incident took place on the night of January 7, the police said.

title: How Trump's Venezuela Move Puts China's Oil Supply Chain At Risk
content: When it comes to claiming that Venezuelan oil is now under his control, President Donald Trump is mincing no words. But no small part of that oil belongs to China under contracts it struck with Caracas years ago

title: Amit Shah Chairs Security Review Meeting On Jammu And Kashmir
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday said counter- terror operations targeting terrorist infrastructure and terror financing must continue in a "mission mode".

title: Trump Rules Out Pardon For Sean "Diddy" Combs
content: Sean "Diddy" Combs, who is serving a four-year prison sentence for prostitution-related crimes, has asked Donald Trump for a pardon, but the US president said he does not plan to grant clemency to the hip-hop star.

title: BJP Is "Power Hungry", Not "Pro-Hindutva", Says Uddhav Thackeray
content: Shiv Sena-UBT Chief Uddhav Thackeray has launched a fierce political attack against the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), predicting a grim future for the Eknath Shinde-led Sena faction and accusing the BJP of eroding Maharashtra's political culture.

title: Mike McDaniel fired: Why Dolphins made move and could John Harbaugh be next?"
content: the Miami Dolphins fired coach Mike McDaniel after a 7-10 season . the Dolphins started the 2025 season by losing seven of their first nine games . but the team lost its next two games to seal its second consecutive loss .

title: College football transfer portal: Tracking who's on the move
content: Max Olson ranks Cincinnati's Brendan Sorsby as the top player in the transfer portal and predicts a recruitment battle between Texas Tech and LSU. (1:04) College football's transfer portal officially opened at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. By midday on Day 1, more than 4,500 Division I college football players have entered the transfer portal. Players now have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

content: Anuja Jaiswal is a Senior Assistant Editor at The Times of India, with an impressive 18-year career in narrative journalism. She specializes in health and heritage reporting, expertly simplifying complex health information to make it engaging and understandable for readers. Her deep dives into heritage topics are well-researched, resulting in captivating narratives that resonate with her audience. content: Atul Mathur is a Senior Assistant Editor at The Times of India with over 27 years of experience in journalism. Based in Delhi, he has spent much of his career reporting on governance, public policy and politics, churning out researched, data-driven stories that impact daily lives. He currently tracks the energy sector, writing on power, renewable energy, coal and mines.
